title: Fire rune

properties.name: description
properties.value: The fire rune is one of the four basic elemental runes. Fire runes can be created from Rune essence or Pure essence through the Runecraft skill, procured from drops by killing monsters, bought from other players, purchased from magic shops, or picked up from spawns on the ground. Fire giants are among the monsters that drop fire runes often and in large quantities.

Item ID554

The fire rune is one of the four basic elemental runes. Fire runes can be created from Rune essence or Pure essence through the Runecraft skill, procured from drops by killing monsters, bought from other players, purchased from magic shops, or picked up from spawns on the ground. Fire giants are among the monsters that drop fire runes often and in large quantities.

Fire runes can be created using the Runecraft skill at level 14 at the Fire Altar north of Al Kharid, which gives 7 experience per essence used. At 35 Runecraft, 2 fire runes are created per essence, and at 70, 3 fire runes are created.

Runecrafting fire runes is one of the fastest ways to achieve 44 Runecraft for natures, through the use of rings of dueling. Players can teleport to Castle Wars to bank and then walk/run to Wizard Cromperty located in East Ardougne north-east of the market place to teleport back to the Rune Essence. Then you can teleport to the Al Kharid Duel Arena entrance, which is close to the Fire Altar. This method uses two charges per trip, allowing four trips per dueling ring. From 14 to 44 Runecraft, one can expect to use over 100 dueling rings. Players can complete Enter the Abyss to unlock a small pouch to increase carrying capacity by 2 essences. At 25 Runecraft, medium pouches can be used, allowing a total of 7 additional essences per trip.

Fire runes spawn on the ground inside the Karamja volcano, where the Lesser demons are. There are five spawns here, each with one fire rune. However, it is not recommended that players gather fire runes here because it is slow and dangerous.

{{External|rs|rsc}} {{Infobox Item |name = Fire rune |image = [[File:Fire rune.png]] |release = [[4 January]] [[2001]] |update = Runescape beta is now online! |members = No |quest = No |tradeable = Yes |placeholder = Yes |equipable = No |stackable = Yes |noteable = No |destroy = Drop |examine = One of the 4 basic elemental Runes. |respawn = 100 |value = 4 |weight = 0.000 |exchange = Yes |id = 554 }} [[File:Fire rune detail.png|left|120px]] The '''fire rune''' is one of the four basic elemental [[runes]]. Fire runes can be created from [[Rune essence]] or [[Pure essence]] through the [[Runecraft]] skill, procured from drops by killing [[monster]]s, bought from other players, purchased from [[magic shops]], or picked up from [[spawn]]s on the ground. [[Fire giant]]s are among the monsters that drop fire runes often and in large quantities. Fire runes can be created using the Runecraft skill at level 14 at the [[Fire Altar]] north of [[Al Kharid]], which gives 7 experience per essence used. At 35 Runecraft, 2 fire runes are created per essence, and at 70, 3 fire runes are created. Runecrafting fire runes is one of the fastest ways to achieve 44 Runecraft for [[Nature rune|natures]], through the use of [[rings of dueling]]. Players can teleport to Castle Wars to bank and then walk/run to Wizard Cromperty located in [[East Ardougne]] north-east of the market place to teleport back to the Rune Essence. Then you can teleport to the Al Kharid [[Duel Arena]] entrance, which is close to the Fire Altar. This method uses two charges per trip, allowing four trips per dueling ring. From 14 to 44 Runecraft, one can expect to use over 100 dueling rings. Players can complete [[Enter the Abyss]] to unlock a [[small pouch]] to increase carrying capacity by 2 essences. At 25 Runecraft, [[medium pouch]]es can be used, allowing a total of 7 additional essences per trip. Fire runes spawn on the ground inside the Karamja volcano, where the Lesser demons are. There are five spawns here, each with one fire rune. However, it is not recommended that players gather fire runes here because it is slow and dangerous. ==Runecraft info== {{Tabber |tab1=Rune essence |tab1content={{Recipe |skill1 = Runecraft |skill1lvl = 14 |skill1boostable = yes |skill1exp = 7 |members = no |ticks = 1 |facilities = Fire Altar |tools = Fire tiara, Fire talisman |notes = [[Multiple runes|More runes]] per essence every 35th level. |mat1 = Rune essence |output1 = Fire rune }} |tab2=Pure essence |tab2content={{Recipe |skill1 = Runecraft |skill1lvl = 14 |skill1boostable = yes |skill1exp = 7 |members = no |ticks = 1 |facilities = Fire Altar |tools = Fire tiara, Fire talisman |notes = [[Multiple runes|More runes]] per essence every 35th level. |mat1 = Pure essence |output1 = Fire rune }} |tab3=Daeyalt essence |tab3content={{Recipe |skill1 = Runecraft |skill1lvl = 14 |skill1boostable = yes |skill1exp = 10.5 |members = yes |ticks = 1 |facilities = Fire Altar |tools = Fire tiara, Fire talisman |notes = [[Multiple runes|More runes]] per essence every 35th level. |mat1 = Daeyalt essence |mat1cost = no |output1 = Fire rune }} |tab4=Guardian essence |tab4content={{Recipe |skill1 = Runecraft |skill1lvl = 27 |skill1boostable = no |skill1exp = 8 |members = yes |ticks = 1 |facilities = Fire Altar |notes = [[Multiple runes|More runes]] per essence every 35th level.
Accessible only in the [[Guardians of the Rift]] minigame. |mat1 = Guardian essence |mat1cost = no |mat2 = Uncharged cell |mat2itemnote = Only if no overcharged cell is present in inventory. |mat2cost = no |output1 = Fire rune |output2 = Elemental guardian stone |output2cost = no |output3 = Overcharged cell |output3itemnote = Only if a non-overcharged cell is present in inventory. Only one charged cell can be carried at a time. |output3cost = no }} }} {{Fire Rune Spells}} ==Products== {{Uses material list|Fire rune}} ==Item sources== {{Drop sources|Fire rune}} ===Store locations=== {{Store locations list|Fire rune}} ===Item spawns=== {{ItemSpawnTableHead}} {{ItemSpawnLine|name=Fire rune|location=[[Wilderness]] - [[Dark Warriors' Fortress]]|members=No|3026,3637,qty:5}} {{ItemSpawnLine|name=Fire rune|location=[[Al Kharid mine]] - northern end|members=No|3304,3311,qty:3}} {{ItemSpawnLine|name=Fire rune|location=[[Camelot]] - {{FloorNumber|uk=1}} of castle|members=Yes|plane=1 |2768,3500,qty:2}} {{ItemSpawnLine|name=Fire rune|location=[[Crandor and Karamja Dungeon]] - lesser demon area|members=No|mapID=9 |2842,9552|2836,9566|2843,9560|2838,9552|2833,9561}} {{ItemSpawnLine|name=Fire rune|location=[[Chasm of Fire]] - lowest level|members=Yes|mapID=-1 |1450,10099|1421,10096|1419,10062|1454,10063}} {{ItemSpawnTableBottom}} ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = 10 September 2020 |update = A Porcine of Interest |poll = |change = The [[Grand Exchange]] buy limit was changed from 20,000 to 50,000. }} {{Subject changes |date = 13 June 2005 |update = RuneCraft Update and Tweaks |change = The item was graphically updated for a second time. }} {{Subject changes |date = 1 June 2005 |change = The item was graphically updated. }} {{Subject changes footer}} ===Gallery (historical)=== {|style="text-align: center" cellpadding="15" |[[File:Fire rune detail (historical v1).png|center|300x150px]] | |[[File:Fire rune detail.png|center|300x150px]] |- |[[File:Fire rune (historical, v1).png|center]] |[[File:Fire rune (historical, v2).png|center]] |[[File:Fire rune.png|center]] |- |29 March 2004 –
